page.title: 01Worcestershire (NW) Uplands
page.content: Situated on the high ground overlooking the fertile Teme Valley, the area around Mamble and Clows top does not share the prosperity below. Once an agricultural area with coal-mining and orchards it is now in a state of deepening decline. The mines are long closed; the remaining orchards old and unkemp; many of the farms and houses are for sale. Supporting amenities mirror the decline. Clows Top has lost its pubs, garage, Police Station, and all but two small shops. Mamble has lost its Post Office cum shop; its only pub is closed (but an optimistic new owner is to reopen it in January 1986); even the Church lacks an incumbent. Not quite all is gloom: the saw mill on the site of the last colliery is expanding and a pair of new houses are under construction in Mamble.
